what: Client for the Deutsche Bundesbank and European Central Bank APIs
title: Client for the Deutsche Bundesbank and European Central Bank APIs
text: bbk minimal R client Deutsche Bundesbank European Central Bank (ECB) APIs. future, may extended central banks financial institutions. Feel free open issue specific request.

title: Client for the Deutsche Bundesbank and European Central Bank APIs
text: can install released version bbk CRAN : development version GitHub :

title: Client for the Deutsche Bundesbank and European Central Bank APIs
text: bbk functions prefixed either bbk_ ecb_ depending origin data follow naming convention APIs. usual workflow search time series key ECB Portal Bundesbank website use retrieve data.
code: library(bbk)  # fetch 10 year daily yield curve yield_curve <- bbk_data(   flow = "BBSIS",   key = "D.I.ZAR.ZI.EUR.S1311.B.A604.R10XX.R.A.A._Z._Z.A",   start_period = "2020-01-01" ) yield_curve #> # A tibble: 1,163 × 25 #>   date       key           value title freq  bearer_reg item  valuation currency #>   <date>     <chr>         <dbl> <chr> <chr> <chr>      <chr> <chr>     <chr>    #> 1 2020-01-02 BBSIS.D.I.ZA… -0.16 Yiel… daily I          ZAR   ZI        EUR      #> 2 2020-01-03 BBSIS.D.I.ZA… -0.27 Yiel… daily I          ZAR   ZI        EUR      #> 3 2020-01-06 BBSIS.D.I.ZA… -0.27 Yiel… daily I          ZAR   ZI        EUR      #> 4 2020-01-07 BBSIS.D.I.ZA… -0.27 Yiel… daily I          ZAR   ZI        EUR      #> 5 2020-01-08 BBSIS.D.I.ZA… -0.27 Yiel… daily I          ZAR   ZI        EUR      #> # ℹ 1,158 more rows #> # ℹ 16 more variables: issuer_class <chr>, listed_sub <chr>, #> #   security_class <chr>, maturity <chr>, interest_type <chr>, #> #   interest_rate <chr>, redemption <chr>, certificate <chr>, coverage <chr>, #> #   rating <chr>, time_format <chr>, decimals <chr>, unit <chr>, #> #   unit_mult <chr>, category <chr>, unit_eng <chr>

title: Client for the Deutsche Bundesbank and European Central Bank APIs
text: bundesbank: R scripts downloading time-series data Bundesbank. ecb: R interface European Central Bank’s Statistical Data Warehouse (SDW) API. rsdmx: R package reading SDMX data metadata. readsdmx: R package reading SDMX data metadata. pdfetch: R package downloading economic financial time series public sources.

what: bbk: Client for the Deutsche Bundesbank and European Central Bank APIs — bbk-package
title: bbk: Client for the Deutsche Bundesbank and European Central Bank APIs — bbk-package
text: Download data metadata 'Bundesbank SDMX Web Service API' found https://www.bundesbank.de/en/statistics/time-series-databases/help--sdmx-web-service/web-service-interface-data 'ECB Data Portal API' found https://data.ecb.europa.eu/help/api/overview.

title: bbk: Client for the Deutsche Bundesbank and European Central Bank APIs — bbk-package
text: Maintainer: Maximilian Mücke muecke.maximilian@gmail.com (ORCID)

what: Returns Bundesbank data for a given flow and key — bbk_data
title: Returns Bundesbank data for a given flow and key — bbk_data
text: Returns Bundesbank data given flow key

title: Returns Bundesbank data for a given flow and key — bbk_data
code: bbk_data(   flow,   key = NULL,   start_period = NULL,   end_period = NULL,   first_n = NULL,   last_n = NULL )

title: Returns Bundesbank data for a given flow and key — bbk_data
text: https://www.bundesbank.de/en/statistics/time-series-databases/help--sdmx-web-service/web-service-interface-data

title: Returns Bundesbank data for a given flow and key — bbk_data
text: flow character(1) flow query, 5-8 characters. See bbk_metadata() available dataflows. key character(1) key query. start_period character(1) start date data. Supported formats: YYYY annual data (e.g., "2019") YYYY-S[1-2] semi-annual data (e.g., "2019-S1") YYYY-Q[1-4] quarterly data (e.g., "2019-Q1") YYYY-MM monthly data (e.g., "2019-01") YYYY-W[01-53] weekly data (e.g., "2019-W01") YYYY-MM-DD daily business data (e.g., "2019-01-01") NULL, start date restriction applied (data retrieved earliest available date). Default NULL. end_period character(1) end date data, format start_period. NULL, end date restriction applied (data retrieved recent available date). Default NULL. first_n numeric(1) number observations retrieve start series. NULL, restriction applied. Default NULL. last_n numeric(1) number observations retrieve end series. NULL, restriction applied. Default NULL.

title: Returns Bundesbank data for a given flow and key — bbk_data
text: data.frame() requested data.

title: Returns Bundesbank data for a given flow and key — bbk_data
code: # \donttest{ # fetch all data for a given flow and key bbk_data("BBSIS", "D.I.ZAR.ZI.EUR.S1311.B.A604.R10XX.R.A.A._Z._Z.A") #> # A tibble: 6,918 × 25 #>    date       key          value title freq  bearer_reg item  valuation currency #>    <date>     <chr>        <dbl> <chr> <chr> <chr>      <chr> <chr>     <chr>    #>  1 1997-08-07 BBSIS.D.I.Z…  5.76 Yiel… daily I          ZAR   ZI        EUR      #>  2 1997-08-08 BBSIS.D.I.Z…  5.76 Yiel… daily I          ZAR   ZI        EUR      #>  3 1997-08-11 BBSIS.D.I.Z…  5.75 Yiel… daily I          ZAR   ZI        EUR      #>  4 1997-08-12 BBSIS.D.I.Z…  5.72 Yiel… daily I          ZAR   ZI        EUR      #>  5 1997-08-13 BBSIS.D.I.Z…  5.77 Yiel… daily I          ZAR   ZI        EUR      #>  6 1997-08-14 BBSIS.D.I.Z…  5.74 Yiel… daily I          ZAR   ZI        EUR      #>  7 1997-08-15 BBSIS.D.I.Z…  5.72 Yiel… daily I          ZAR   ZI        EUR      #>  8 1997-08-18 BBSIS.D.I.Z…  5.72 Yiel… daily I          ZAR   ZI        EUR      #>  9 1997-08-19 BBSIS.D.I.Z…  5.66 Yiel… daily I          ZAR   ZI        EUR      #> 10 1997-08-20 BBSIS.D.I.Z…  5.71 Yiel… daily I          ZAR   ZI        EUR      #> # ℹ 6,908 more rows #> # ℹ 16 more variables: issuer_class <chr>, listed_sub <chr>, #> #   security_class <chr>, maturity <chr>, interest_type <chr>, #> #   interest_rate <chr>, redemption <chr>, certificate <chr>, coverage <chr>, #> #   rating <chr>, time_format <chr>, decimals <chr>, unit <chr>, #> #   unit_mult <chr>, category <chr>, unit_eng <chr> # fetch data for multiple keys bbk_data("BBK01", c("TTA032", "TTA010")) #> # A tibble: 5,184 × 10 #>    date       key   value title freq  dim1  time_format decimals unit  unit_mult #>    <date>     <chr> <dbl> <chr> <chr> <chr> <chr>       <chr>    <chr> <chr>     #>  1 1998-12-22 BBK0…     0 Clai… daily TTA0… P1D         0        EURO  6         #>  2 1999-01-01 BBK0…     0 Clai… daily TTA0… P1D         0        EURO  6         #>  3 1999-01-08 BBK0…     0 Clai… daily TTA0… P1D         0        EURO  6         #>  4 1999-01-15 BBK0…     0 Clai… daily TTA0… P1D         0        EURO  6         #>  5 1999-01-22 BBK0…     0 Clai… daily TTA0… P1D         0        EURO  6         #>  6 1999-01-29 BBK0…     0 Clai… daily TTA0… P1D         0        EURO  6         #>  7 1999-02-05 BBK0…     0 Clai… daily TTA0… P1D         0        EURO  6         #>  8 1999-02-12 BBK0…     0 Clai… daily TTA0… P1D         0        EURO  6         #>  9 1999-02-19 BBK0…     0 Clai… daily TTA0… P1D         0        EURO  6         #> 10 1999-02-26 BBK0…     0 Clai… daily TTA0… P1D         0        EURO  6         #> # what: Returns the available Bundesbank metadata — bbk_metadata
title: Returns the available Bundesbank metadata — bbk_metadata
text: Retrieval metadata stored Bundesbank's time series database. Access via SDMX Web Service API Bundesbank.

title: Returns the available Bundesbank metadata — bbk_metadata
Returns the available Bundesbank metadata — bbk_metadata
text: https://www.bundesbank.de/en/statistics/time-series-databases/help--sdmx-web-service/web-service-interface-metadata

title: Returns the available Bundesbank metadata — bbk_metadata
text: type character(1) type metadata query. One : "datastructure", "dataflow", "codelist", "concept". id character(1) id query. Default NULL. lang character(1) language query, either "en" "de". Default "en".

title: Returns the available Bundesbank metadata — bbk_metadata
text: data.frame() queried metadata. columns : id id metadata name name metadata

title: Returns the available Bundesbank metadata — bbk_metadata
code: # \donttest{ bbk_metadata("datastructure") #> # A tibble: 83 × 2 #>    id        name                                                                #>    <chr>     <chr>                                                               #>  1 BBK_BSPL  Profit and loss                                                     #>  2 BBK_DOES  Short-term economic indicators (classified by economic sector)      #>  3 BBK_ERX   ECB euro reference exchange rates, exchange rates in particular co… #>  4 BBK_ESBOP External sector Balance of Payments according to BPM6               #>  5 BBK_EXBS  Business and consumer surveys of foreign countries                  #>  6 BBK_DOSC  System of  indicators for the German commercial real estate market  #>  7 BBK_DOSR  System of indicators for the German residential property market     #>  8 BBK_EXNA  National Accounts of foreign countries                              #>  9 BBK_EXPR  Consumer Prices of foreign countries                                #> 10 BBK_EXEI  Leading indicators of foreign countries                             #> # ℹ 73 more rows bbk_metadata("dataflow", "BBSIS") #> # A tibble: 1 × 2 #>   id    name                                 #>   <chr> <chr>                                #> 1 BBSIS Securities Issues Statistics (Bonds) bbk_metadata("codelist", "CL_BBK_ACIP_ASSET_LIABILITY") #> # A tibble: 3 × 2 #>   id                          name                 #>   <chr>                       <chr>                #> 1 CL_BBK_ACIP_ASSET_LIABILITY Assets / Liabilities #> 2 CL_BBK_ACIP_ASSET_LIABILITY Assets               #> 3 CL_BBK_ACIP_ASSET_LIABILITY Liabilities          bbk_metadata("concept", "CS_BBK_BSPL") #> # A tibble: 38 × 2 #>    id          name                                          #>    <chr>       <chr>                                         #>  1 CS_BBK_BSPL Profit and loss                               #>  2 CS_BBK_BSPL Frequency (BBk)                               #>  3 CS_BBK_BSPL Area (countries, list of countries), BBk only #>  4 CS_BBK_BSPL Adjustment (BBk)                              #>  5 CS_BBK_BSPL Reference sector breakdown                    #>  6 CS_BBK_BSPL Profit/Loss Item                              #>  7 CS_BBK_BSPL Original maturity                             #>  8 CS_BBK_BSPL Data type                                     #>  9 CS_BBK_BSPL Counterpart area                              #> 10 CS_BBK_BSPL Counterpart Sector                            #> # what: Returns ECB data for a given flow and key — ecb_data
title: Returns ECB data for a given flow and key — ecb_data
text: Returns ECB data given flow key

title: Returns ECB data for a given flow and key — ecb_data
code: ecb_data(   flow,   key = NULL,   start_period = NULL,   end_period = NULL,   first_n = NULL,   last_n = NULL )

title: Returns ECB data for a given flow and key — ecb_data
text: https://data.ecb.europa.eu/help/api/data

title: Returns ECB data for a given flow and key — ecb_data
text: flow character(1) flow query. key character(1) key query. start_period character(1) start date data. Supported formats: YYYY annual data (e.g., "2019") YYYY-S[1-2] semi-annual data (e.g., "2019-S1") YYYY-Q[1-4] quarterly data (e.g., "2019-Q1") YYYY-MM monthly data (e.g., "2019-01") YYYY-W[01-53] weekly data (e.g., "2019-W01") YYYY-MM-DD daily business data (e.g., "2019-01-01") NULL, start date restriction applied (data retrieved earliest available date). Default NULL. end_period character(1) end date data, format start_period. NULL, end date restriction applied (data retrieved recent available date). Default NULL. first_n numeric(1) number observations retrieve start series. NULL, restriction applied. Default NULL. last_n numeric(1) number observations retrieve end series. NULL, restriction applied. Default NULL.

title: Returns ECB data for a given flow and key — ecb_data
code:
# \donttest{ # fetch US dollar/Euro exchange rate ecb_data("EXR", "D.USD.EUR.SP00.A") #> Error in req_perform(req_error(req_url_query(req_url_path_append(req_user_agent(request("https://data-api.ecb.europa.eu/service/"), "bbk (https://m-muecke.github.io/bbk)"), resource), ...), body = ecb_error_body)): HTTP 404 Not Found. #> • No results found. #> • See docs at # fetch data for multiple keys ecb_data("EXR", c("D.USD", "JPY.EUR.SP00.A")) #> Error in req_perform(req_error(req_url_query(req_url_path_append(req_user_agent(request("https://data-api.ecb.europa.eu/service/"), "bbk (https://m-muecke.github.io/bbk)"), resource), ...), body = ecb_error_body)): HTTP 500 Internal Server Error. #> • European Central Bank

ECB Data

ECB Data Portal gives an error, please try with our home page https://data.ecb.europa.eu

If our home page brought you here, we are working to make it again available for you. Please try again after few minutes.

We apologize for any inconvenience this might have caused.

HTTP status code: 500

#> • See docs at # }

what: Euro foreign exchange reference rates — ecb_euro_rates
title: Euro foreign exchange reference rates — ecb_euro_rates
text: Fetch latest historical Euro foreign exchange reference rates European Central Bank.

title: Euro foreign exchange reference rates — ecb_euro_rates
Euro foreign exchange reference rates — ecb_euro_rates
text: http://www.ecb.europa.eu/stats/eurofxref/

title: Euro foreign exchange reference rates — ecb_euro_rates
text: x character(1) one "latest" "history". Default "latest".

title: Euro foreign exchange reference rates — ecb_euro_rates
text: data.frame() reference rates.

title: Euro foreign exchange reference rates — ecb_euro_rates
text: Note can achieve calling ecb_data() function right parameters currency. reference rates usually updated around 16:00 CET every working day, except TARGET closing days. based daily concertation procedure central banks across Europe, normally takes place around 14:10 CET. reference rates published information purposes . Using rates transaction purposes strongly discouraged.

title: Euro foreign exchange reference rates — ecb_euro_rates

text: type character(1) type metadata query. One : "datastructure", "dataflow", "codelist", "concept". agency character(1) id agency query. Default NULL. id character(1) id resource query. Default NULL.

title: Returns the available ECB metadata — ecb_metadata
text: data.frame() queried metadata. columns : agency agency metadata id id metadata name name metadata
